question_text: What does the '64-bit' data width of memory refer to?
answer_options: The number of memory slots on a motherboard
The total memory capacity of a system
The number of bits transferred in one memory operation
The size of the CPU register
correct_answer: The number of bits transferred in one memory operation
explanation: A 64-bit data width means each memory operation transfers 64 bits of data at once. This is a standard data width for modern memory modules.
